values:
Okay, so, apparently, the literal translation of "porcupine" in jpns is "needle mouse".

...and people wonder why I majored in this language. *sporfle*

In more relevant news, my job interveiw went well,'but I still have one more to go. Auughh! But at least it didn't go horribly, horribly wrong!(For once.)

Also, I had toasted marshmallows for lunch. Heh. ^-^

Sooo, this is the creek that runs through our neighborhood. Normally, it runs *under* the roads, however. And this is the raging river that the little 3-feet-wide creek turned into on the other side of the neighborhood. So, that's two roads out of three that will need repairs.*sigh* Fortunately, the rain seems to have stopped for now. :)

Sooo, the cat woke us up this morning, by standing at our bedroom doors and yowling pitifully for, er,....a while. And when we get downstairs to the kitchen, what do we discover? 

ANTS. Millions, and MILLIONS of *ants*. Yep, apparently, the rain drove them to higher ground, and then they decided to just invade. Thus, we have a whole anthill's worth of dead ants in a 4-inch stream across the floor. (They weren't dead to start, but after nearly fumigating myself and the cat, they sure are now. *smirk*)
Unfortunately, they're still coming in, and I'm still not exactly sure where they're coming in from.

*Siiiiiiiigh*

I hate having bugs in the house.

Sooo, I made my neice (the crazy Naruto fangirl) a present. Or three. Heh. Lookit! And the giant cat summon attacks! You can't see it because of the clothes, but they all have the seal embroidered on their tummies. (Oiroke no Jutsu Naruto's clothes come off, btw. Lol! She almost came dressed in artfully placed puffs of smoke, but I liked that fabric a lot, and thought it was one he'd wear, given the chance, so. Lo, clothes. *grin*) ...I am so proud of myself. *hee* For the record: clothes without patterns are reallyreallyhardOMG. Also, Iron transfer= win! Felt eyes are cute, but not much with the accurate. And luckily, the iron tranfer material does not stick till it cools, cause otherwise, movie!Naruto would have an eye in the middle of his forehead. (No jagan for you, plushy-kun!*snerk*)

I made a skirt! For myself, even. Hee. It came out well, I think, esp. for a first try. Looks kinda like this: The pattern on the fabric is done in embroidery, and the material is that fuzzy suede-like stuff. It's pretty. I was lazy, so I left out some of the details of the pattern, but you get the general idea. :)

Hey, Muuurriiiii!!

Wanna go ogle the men in leather pants with us this weekend? *waggles eyebrows* I hear they have the Lipazzans this year! (pretty horseys, heeee.)
This is the last weekend, so unless it's pouring giraffes and rhinoceri, we'll most likely be going. ^_^

Check this out, Muri, you will love this artist, she's *awesome* (And seems to have a love of fuzzy critters, too.) 
http://hibbary.deviantart.com/gallery/#_featured

So, have some tunes, courtesy of the internetz and my step-mom's massive CD collection, which I raided last weekend. (Apparently, I like jazz. Who knew?)

Anyway. Songs for joo:

Dragon Wings, by Keiko Matsui 
It's bouncy and pretty, and *I* like it, anyway. Also, it has drgons in the name. *shrug* Your mileage may vary. (Btw, I've never uploaded iPod songs before, so lemme know if I didn't do it right.)
http://www.mediafire.com/?zdnm1mim1mz

Garden, by Keiko Matsui
Again, it's pretty. Makes nice background music for those times you don't want sudden booms and crashes, but isn't the sort to put you to sleep.
http://www.mediafire.com/?wnjex2tmwyp

aaand now for something completely different!
This one's an old favorite in my family, lol. 
Excellent for singing in empty Japanese subway stations.
The Scotsman!
http://www.mediafire.com/?mbe44yztogy

Please enjoy music to a happy time!
...And feel free to share your own. *grin*

Sooo, I like to burn things. In fact, I am an acknowledged and unapologetic pyromaniac. Luckily, my father has always been a bit of an aspiring Mad Scientist/Inventor, and was quite pleased to indulge me, since it meant he got to continue his life-long study on the explosive qualities of a wide assortment of household products. I have happy memories of standing over fires of varying sizes, and getting absentminded advice from Dad. Mainly along the lines of "Suuure, throw that in, it'll burn." and "You might want stand back a bit with that one." Oh, and the classic, "Here, try this one, it burns green!" He and my brother, on the other hand, tended to quickly lose interest in fires that did not also result in explosions. Not so, yours truly. No, it is a well known fact in my family that if my assistance is needed in house or yardwork, setting something on fire is the way to both acquire and *keep* my interest. Leaves, sticks, small outbuildings, whatever. As long as there are still visible flames, I'm there. *heh* Thus, I am our family's official Burner of Things What Have Piled Up. Many a happy fall day I have spent, gleefully chucking mounds of leaves into a burn barrel. (Affectionately referred to by my Dad and I as "the Belchmaster", the burn barrel was an idea of his, in which a small hole is punched into the bottom of a large steel barrel, and a metal tube is fed into said hole. Add a medium-size shop-fan to the other end of the tube, and lo! Instant incinerator. It works brilliantly. You can burn whole *trees* in less than half an hour!Muwahaha. And it burns so hot, there's hardly any smoke!) When I'm not traumatizing the local fire-department, my jobs range from Chief Stick Picker-Upper (so that I will have more things to burn), to Part-time Hedge Tamer,(which, coincidentally, *also* results in more things to burn!) Best of all is the fact that unlike in my younger years, I am now considered reasonably trustworthy, (in that I have not blown-up anything important in *recent* memory), and thus I get to burn things without supervision. (As opposed to my older brother, who just last weekend felt it helpful to add kerosene to an open burn pile at my Dad's house. I was occupied in the back-yard with the Belchmaster, and thus escaped the Wrath of Mom. He gets into trouble even *with* supervision. *smirk*) Naturally, there is often a rather large wait between fires, since things have to accumulate into a decent-sized pile before I am allowed to set them ablaze. However, at this time of year, the piles grow at a pace sufficient to allow me to toast my way through a large bag of marshmallows every other weekend. (Heh. I love pruning season.) Anyway, this week, the pile grew much, much larger and faster than normal, due to the contribution of several large azaleas that got a severe haircut. Thus, the amount of To-be-torched was roughly three times the size of the usual. Add in several other factors, like a stack of old crates and wooden pallets, and the 4 x 4 x 4' pile of pruned limbs off the huge forsythia bushes out front, and you have the makings of a first-class, grade-A, all-day bonfire! ...However! The Assistant Stick Picker-Uppers elected to combine all of the burnables into one large pile, instead of making several small piles from which I could have fed the fire. .... Now, given my admitted pyromania, when presented with the options of: a) Very Large Fire!!, and b) hauling branches and whatnot off the pile until it was closer to the usual size, which do you suppose I chose? ...Darned right! Yours truly went *straight* for the lighter. Mwa.Ha.Ha.Ha! BUUUUUUURRRRN. But! Upon reflection, (and post- several Rather Exciting Moments), I feel that today's Garden Lesson must be: Burn *smaller* piles. SMALL PILES ONLY, crazywoman! Because when it went up, it went *up*. Nearly twenty-five feet, in fact. The whooole pile. At once. (It was Awesome. *glee*) However, the extreme heat ended up singeing the nearest tree's lowest branches pretty badly, and resulted in several panicked minutes of hose-wielding from a rather distressed Hima. It also resulted in some alarmed neighborhood children, who apparently could see the fire from over a high privacy fence, and despite being down a steep slope. Luckily, their parents are used to the sight of smoke coming from our yard, so I did not get a visit from the fire-department this time. *sheepish expression* The fire was even hot enough to melt some old aluminum window frames that ended up in the pile somehow. ...*shifty eyes* (Melted metal is fun!) So yeah, I had a good time today. Hee. I do feel a little bad about the tree, but Mom's not fussed, so I'm not too concerned. Apparently, those branches were scheduled for pruning anyhow. ...More for next week's pile. *evil grin* Anyway. If I remember, I'll post pics of the strange plant Mom got for the shade garden, (my unofficially claimed territory, since I am deeply allergic to strong sunlight. *grin*) It is stripey and weird and makes purple flowers. I like it!

Sooo, we went to see the Lion King on stage, and it rocked. (Especially Rafiki, because she was *awesome*) and we were greatly impressed by the costumes. I mean seriously, how many actors get to list 'played a whole herd of antelope' on their resume? Though the guy who was the two buzzards kinda got the shaft. There were even life-size elephants! So cool.

Anyway, yay for theatre action! Now back to my usual.

omg, help meeeee. I think I may need an intervention, because over the last few weeks Final Fantasy 7 has *devoured my soul* I mean, I've read and enjoyed FF fics for years, but it was never an actual *fandom*, it was just me reading things by authors I liked. Well, that and also me having a weakness for Sephiroth. But hey, breathing, not blind, so nothing unusual there, right? Anyhow. My online life now belongs to the soul crushing angst and disproportionately large percentage of total hotness that is the cast of FF7. (ohhh, the infinite possible combinations...) I don't even hate the girls! Which is way more than I can say for most of the other fandoms I've been in. However, I will say that my heart belongs to fandom!Cloud. Because he is adorable and broody and he likes chocobos and he really, really needs a hug. Also, everyone wants a Cloud, but they almost never refuse to share. (*Sephiroth.*) He's like chocolate, I swear! He goes with anything and you can't help but love him. I know more about these people than I do the ninjas, Muri. And you know I'm a walking Bingo Book. Although I did read this one awesome crossover between the two... For serious, it is not pretty. I'm actually thinking of ...*shudder*...writing something. Ohyes, things have indeed progressed to that point. Already there have been doodles. No, I will not show you, for they are very pitiful. I'm looking for good fanart to...study, if you know of any. *grin* I have no idea what happened. I mean, there I was, happily lounging about in the Naruto and HP fandoms, when lo, a game I *have never even played* proceeded to stroll up, flirt shamelessly, and then consume my life. It came out of nowhere! Rather like a lightning strike. Or possibly a Meteor. *ahem* Anyway, I need recs, if anyone has 'em. Though most likely, I have read it at some point over the last three weeks. But if not, I will shower you with gratitude. ...I mean, I haven't even seen the *movie!!* Whyyyyy, I ask you. *flails*

Doraemon's workin' for the Man, y'all. *officially* even. 
Apparently there is now an actual Ambassador of Anime, and he is a blue, robotic cat. Who wears a beanie. 

.....

Ah, Japan, we love how you entertain us.

It's my birthday! Yay.


...So far I have received one art program, one textbook (vol. two of the one I got for x-mas, lol), and dinner+a movie.
Not a bad day, all around. Heee.

(The Spiderwick Chronicles is verrry entertaining, and also quite well done, with possibly the best villain death *ever*, btw.)

Now I am making a mess in the sunroom, because I felt a need to make things. Out of felt. With ribbons and such. Much fun, but I shall definitely have to vacuum tomorrow.*g* 

But now I need more cake. ^v^

Sooo, I occasionally have these hilariously entertaining dreams, right?
Well, to me anyway.

Take last night's showing, for example. Final Fantasy, the Musical! It was very peppy, for a series with so many angsty characters. And a one point those two goofy pirates from Pirates of the Carribbean wandered by, still in drag. I recall wondering what they were doing there, but the rest of the production seemed to take it all in stride. 
However, I did not get to see the ending, as Muri and T-chan (who also attended), didn't come back after intermission, and the world's scariest doorman would not let us back in after I went to check on them. I was very sad. But then I remembered Sephiroth, and it wall good.

...Because possibly you have not lived until you have seen *Sephiroth*, in a zoot-suit, singing and dancing. 
He was actually very good. Not that he would be bad at anything, but I distinctly recall being very impressed with his singing voice. I cannot remember what it sounded like, though. *pouts*
But still! Zoot-suit! 
Ahahaha....

Hmmm. However, it just occurred to me that there were no chocobos. Maybe they're too hard to train for the stage? 


So, in summary: GYAHAHAHAahahaha......*Snort*

Because I actually wrote some stuff. It isn't any good, nor would it be of any interest to anyone but me, but still.  Writing. 
The apocalypse may be nigh, folks. *snerk* 

Anyway. How is life? T-chan, if you're out there, we're boxing up goodies for you, so if you have any requests, now is the time. :)
Harry annoys Draco. (Mostly by existing.) However, there are a few things in

It has come to my attention that there is a Hard-rock Cafe in Ottawa.

*shifty eyes*
...Have I ever mentioned I collect Hard-rock Guitar Pins? *grin*

Seriously, if you should have the opportunity to swing by, there is a really nifty puzzle-pin set(in four parts) that looks like a maple leaf when it's put together. I dunno if they still have/have got them yet, (I think it was a special thing for Canada Day, but I could be wrong), but if they do, and you could get me one, I will pay back when you get here. And also love you for ever and ever!

Anyway.
Off to the beach!

Wheee, road trip!

I'll be in somewhat sporadic (read: none, probably)contact for a week or so, if anyone needs me. Them what knows me number should make note to call mum's cell, instead. :)

Woo-hoo! To the Beach! I shall think of you fondly as I make my sandcastles and get my obligatory vacation-sunburn. 
Hee.

I want muri to call me.(!!!)
But besides that, I want a place I can go and find people who have nothing better to do than sit around and tell me WHO THE HECK THAT IS in lj icons. Or at least identify the series. Because there is nothing more frustrating to me than stumbling over random hotness in a 100 x 100 pixel *spec*, and not being able to find mooooore. ARGH.

Today's message brought to you by all those people on lj. The ones who are watching things I am not, obviously. I'm going to go be bitter about that now.
LEGO STARWARS GAME. That is all I have to say. Well, that and: " MERRY KURISUMASU!!!" Hee. Now I gotta go be Lego Jedi. ...*sporfle* Little. Lego. WOOKIE. Aahahahaha

I've been shorn! That's right, I, Hima, she-of-the-absurdly-long-ponytail, have been reduced to merely having long hair. Well, I'm told it's still longish. Feels pretty darn short to me, though. It's going to take ages to get used to it. My arm keeps trying brush the hair that isn't there...and let's not discuss the Shampoo Incident, shall we? 

Muri, when you see it, you will spazz. It's weeeeird. But, I took a page from your book, and now some little bald kid will be running around with my hair to warm her little head. It's supposed to make me feel all warm and fuzzy, but really, it just kind of creeps me out. I feel a sudden sympathy for sheep.

The Ookami game comes out soon! (Next weekish? I think) I say we go halvsies and it can live your house, since we both know I'd never finish it anyway. Mum is out of town for the next month or so, starting Sunday, so all her demands upon my time (have I mentioned the worst yardsale in the history of the world?!), shall cease. And I can come play! (If you feel like being the transportation, of course.)
Give me a call if you want to goof off in my general vicinity!^_^

So like, it's really weird, y'all. The moon is mostly full, and very, very orange. It looks *fake* it's so orange. And also much with the creepiness. 
The not-so-distant wail of police sirens is not reassuring. 

If the world were under attack by evil undead things, you guys would tell, me, right?
...Right?

I need some help! Anyone out there have some suggestions for  *DUBBED* anime that might entertain a bunch of bored air-force guys? 'Cause apparently, my brother and his buddies are tired of subtitles, and would appreciate some new stuff to watch what requires no readin'. *snerk*

And if you do think of some, where might I find these illustrious titles?

DUDE. The big church next to my house apparently decided to have the fireworks a few days early! Of course, the first I knew of it was when the explosions from all that heavy artillery started *SHAKING MY HOUSE*. So I ran outside and located a perfect spot from which to enjoy the (first rate, superb, awesome, and in all ways splendiferous) fireworks! It took up the whole sky!!! I kid you not!! THE WHOLE SKY. I....I think I may expire from sheer pyromaniac glee. EEEEEE!!! 'SPLOSIONS!!!

Well, it's official. Photoshop *hates* me. I can't get it work for anything. It runs for a bit, and then, just when you think all is well, and you can relax, it locks up. Not the computer, just Photoshop. And the best part? It likes to wait until you try to save.

So. I am going insane with great speed. I feel like my existence has no meaning. I'm feeling the need to sit around listening to retarded emo music and wearing black clothes, in order to adequately express my rage at the vile betrayer that is Adobe. 

Also, I have a pile of drawings that I can't color. And as we all know, black and white is only cool in manga. 
I WANT TO MAKE PRETTIES, CURSE YOU, YOU EVIL THING.
*stabstabsporkityspork*

Whhhyyyyy??
*flaily hand wavings!*

weeelll, I *was* talking to muri...but it seems her phone has died.
Muri? Are you out there? Give me a SIGN!

*waits for smoke signal*

and another looong one!
Naruto again, and a rarity in fanfic, with an original character (I think she is, anyway) who isn't a Mary Sue!
http://www.fanfiction.net/s/2422891/1/

hmmm...what else can I get into?...

So, having nothing better to do, I thought I'd post some of the better fics I've gotten attached to lately. Having finally given up on my old rule about never reading unfinished stories, I promptly stumbled onto a dozen or so fantastic writers...none of whom have *ever* finished a story. *headdesk* But! These are all good stories that have been updated fairly recently, and have living authors. I know this, because they write *other* stories, while they leave me hanging on the one I like. *sporks them* Anyway, here's a random collection of things to read, if you don't mind having to wait for the ending. Annnd, anything I rec carries an implicit rec for the rest of the author's work, unless I say otherwise. Fair warning, I prefer AUs and crossovers. In the top slot, the fic that ate my brain: Team 8 by S'TarKan Naruto AU, Gen, well written and highly addictive. Updates monthly, more or less. Reeeead it. In the crack-addled but "OMGthisficisLOVE, I tell you!" category: Jedi Harris by The Dark Scribbler Multi-series crossover, mainly Buffy. The title says it all, really. This story is awesome. But very, very long. Gen Technically it's complete, but it has an unfinished sequel, so. In the "Xander! I missed you!" category: Carving Out a Future by Dreamfall Buffy/Firefly crossover, gen so far. Lovely, loveable story. Updates fairly quickly, but never quick *enough*! and there was more, but I accidentally deleted the rest of the post. So I'll have to add those later, 'cause I don't feel like typing all that out again. Argh.

For reasons unknown to me, my friends page has not updated since the 19th. 

?buh? O_o

I just spent roughly five hours working on a drawing, (and I was quite happy with the finished work),only to discover that it did not save properly when I told it to. So now, I have nothing. 
Nada. 
Except a cramped wrist and a bad mood.
ARGH.
...Should have gone with my first plan for the afernoon, and started that sewing project instead.
*headdesk*

So yeah, bored now.

I have this shiny new art program...and no idea what I want to draw. Argh. It's such a pain drawing straght into the computer. But I need to get better at it, I guess.
Any suggestions for a project?  

Anybody? 

*crickets chirp in backgound*

........

-.-  
*sigh*

OMG BABY SQUIRREL!!! Soooo. There we were, on this fine, chilly afternoon, standing around outside for assorted reasons, when lo! We looked down, and and found ourselves in the presence of an outrageously cute baby squirrel. He (or she, we haven't been so rude as to inquire yet), was not in the least bit scared, and in fact seemed quite confident that we looked like the kind of people who could sort things out for him. Seeing as he'd gotten a bit confused, you see. And really, a nice warm cup of tea would be lovely, thanks. Of course, being the type of people who can't resist anything cute and fuzzy (you know, *thooooose* people. the ones with the cats. and a small mountain of old critter habitats in the garage), we naturally had a collective fit over him, and carried him inside to be loved and cuddled and called George. And, after having looked up baby squirrels and their needs (google, thou art my truest love), I managed to convince my family that *NO*, we did not want to become his mommies. No, what we are doing instead is : 1) giving him a nice warm place to sleep tonight, 2) putting as much of the Pedialyte-substitute down him as he'll take, and 3) trying to get him back to his real mommy in the morning. The very nice lady I called for advice said that since he's not hurt or visibly ill, most likely he's just hungry and lost. If his mommy hears him calling, she will apparently come running, and by tomorrow afternoon, he will be back in his tree with her. But, in the worst case scenario, there are some folks in the area who will be better able to care for him until he's ready to head out on his own. In the meantime, OMG *CUTE AND FUZZY!!!!EEEEE!!!* Ahem. *sparkles* Fluffy tail! Hee.

I have just spent the better part of the last four days (and nights) reading ff.net.   

And I don't even feel particularly traumatized. Heck, I think I may even be *enjoying* myself. O_o

...Isn't that one of the signs of the apocalypse?

And so, to celebrate the long-awaited return of my computer, I 'm willing to doodle for anyone willing to admit to being online. Anything you want, though I make no promises about my ability to *render* your request. I may let Rodney mock you mercilessly instead. He's fun like that.
*snerk*


In summary:
...MURI. T-CHAN. Why are you not here for me to chew on?!? *wail*

EEEEEEEEE!!!!!!!!!!OMG*stare*  *rewind*  *STARE*    !!!!!!!!!1!!!11!!!

Duuuude. I--

 I have just experienced one of the finest hours of my television viewing life to date.
(eee!!)

Dude. And I thought *I* obsessed over cartoons. Check *this* out! http://bleedman.snafu-comics.com/?strip_id=143 It's a doujin of Cartoon Network shows! And it's really good. Anyone out there with Open Canvas and some time to kill, just let me know, 'K?  I'm losing my mind here, so I need to play silly games and doodle at people. *grin*

edit:
....I make my own fun. yay. 
OMGPLAYWITHMEEEEEE.
*ahem*
That is all.

Okay, so I may be the last person in the world to find out about this thing, but good lord, does it ever rock my world. If you don't know about Open Canvas, it's a freeware paintprogram, available in many places, but you can go here and get version 1.1 from a person who isn't me, but is wonderful nonetheless. Once you have it, go here and read a nice little online guide about it. Pay particular attention to the NETWORKING. Because seriously, things that are this much fun should not be legal. *waits impatiently for someone to get online*

So, in an act of shameless thievery, I'm swiping an idea from somebody who might possibly be even more bored! 

Doodle meme: aka  Give me a one line prompt (from fandom or not), and I'll doodle it.  Any fandom is cool, but if I don't recognize it, I may ask for another prompt. Don't expect great art here, folks, I'm just killing time. :)

Anybody out there have a suggestion/ link to someone who's accepting non-essential donations? Things that serve no purpose other than to make somebody's life a little less bleak? I know money is the best, but uh, I haven't got any. (i'm mooching off my parents as it is.) I do, however have quite a lot of clothes, toys, books, etc. that I could donate.
I know the local agencies take clothes, but i had heard some vague rumblings of people who were sending things like books and toys out to the evacuated families in texas, and I was thinking that sounded like a fine idea.  Any pointers?  Thanks in advance!



and from the escapist weekly happy place:
Duuuuude. Is it weird that I find Scary Sheppard to be so ridulously hot? Because, um, yeah. GUH. 
T-chan, you are going to *die* when you see it! *SQUEE* is the operative word, I tell you. Squee!!
